newsitem.title: ZAMBIA: Foreign-owned United Bank opens doors in Zambia.
newsitem.headline: Foreign-owned United Bank opens doors in Zambia.

text.p: Foreign-based United Bank Zambia Ltd opened its doors in the Zambian capital Lusaka on Wednesday -- the 19th operating bank in the country.
Owned by investors from East Africa, the Middle East, Britain and Asia, the bank launched its first branch on Wednesday with an initial paid up capital of two billion kwacha ($1.5 million).

"The bank management looks forward to maintaining a strong capital and financial base to offer continued assurance to its customers about the health of the operations," bank manager Pramod Khanna told Reuters.

"The promoters of the bank, in due course, also aim to invite local participation in the capital, both to enhance the resource base, and also to seek local initiative and support in the promotion and development of its business," he added.

The opening of United Bank follows a period of uncertainty in Zambia's banking sector in which three local banks, Meridien BIAO Bank Zambia, Africa Commercial Bank and Commerce Bank, collapsed due to severe liquidity problems in 1995. ($1=1,320 kwacha)
